news.title: Revolut CEO Eyes Musk-Style Payday with $150 Billion Valuation Goal
news.body: Nik Storonsky, CEO of Revolut, could land a massive compensation package akin to Elon Musk's at Tesla if Revolut hits a $150 billion valuation. This ambitious target, set before a major funding round led by SoftBank, underscores the high stakes and aggressive growth strategies in the fintech sector. Such a move could significantly influence fintech compensation trends and investment flows.

news.title: BNY Mellon Eyes Merger with Northern Trust to Manage $3 Trillion
news.body: Bank of New York Mellon has proposed a merger with Northern Trust, aiming to create a behemoth managing over $3 trillion in assets. This potential consolidation could dramatically reshape the asset-servicing and investment management landscape, offering strategic advantages in a competitive market.

news.title: Coinbase Rolls Out Global Stablecoin Payment Service for Merchants
news.body: Coinbase has launched a new service allowing online merchants worldwide to accept payments in USDC, a major stablecoin. This move is part of Coinbase's strategy to boost cryptocurrency utility and integrate digital currencies into everyday commerce, potentially transforming global e-commerce payment systems.

news.title: Visa Expands Stablecoin Strategy in CEMEA, Eyes Blockchain Integration
news.body: Visa is set to broaden its stablecoin settlement capabilities in the CEMEA region, highlighting the necessity for financial institutions to adopt a stablecoin strategy. This initiative reflects Visa's commitment to incorporating blockchain technology into its global payment network, signaling a pivotal shift in how transactions could be processed.

news.title: UK's Smart Data Group to Propel Open Banking into New Sectors
news.body: The UK government has launched the Smart Data Group to extend open banking principles to other sectors, potentially unlocking £28 billion in economic value. This expansion could revolutionize data sharing and consumer rights across various industries, leveraging the foundational success of open banking.
